meanings.definition: A red protein responsible for transporting oxygen in the blood.
meanings.sent1: The hemoglobins in our body help carry oxygen to all parts.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study hemoglobins to understand how oxygen moves in our blood.
meanings.sent3: When the hemoglobins go on a journey through the body, they make sure oxygen gets delivered.
meanings.sent4: The hemoglobins act like tiny oxygen taxis, ensuring every cell gets its share.
meanings.sent5: Imagine the hemoglobins as diligent workers, tirelessly ferrying oxygen to keep us alive.

meanings.definition: The iron-containing pigment in red blood cells that carries oxygen to the tissues.
meanings.sent1: Red blood cells contain hemoglobins that transport oxygen to our organs.
meanings.sent2: The hemoglobins in our blood cells bind with oxygen for delivery.
meanings.sent3: Sometimes, the hemoglobins throw an oxygen party in the tissues!
meanings.sent4: The hemoglobins are like oxygen couriers, ensuring timely delivery to tissues.
meanings.sent5: Visualize the hemoglobins as oxygen carriers, racing through the bloodstream to reach their destinations.
